And if not why do we keep calling god a he?

You can go farther:
 
 Does God have legs? Why would he need to walk on anything? A digestive system? What would he eat, even if he needed to? Two eyes? How can he see everything that's going on everywhere every second with only two? A bladder? Where does he pee, and what would he ingest that would cause him to? Lungs? God doesn't need to breathe air.
 
 If we really were made in His image, I'd say we've been heavily accessorized.

If not a "He", then neither a "She", so must be an "It".

 
 No.. It means god is a little bit of She/He/It.
Ok. Or none of the above! ;)

That question has echoes to the Romans, who often had an archway built at the perimeter of their temple enclosures to provide an entrance passageway to the holy place.

 Nah. There's no credible support for that nonsense.

Accipiter, it is an old Jewish problem.
 
 Religious Jews were admonished to love God, or the deity, as they loved their earthly beloveds, in a sensual, even erotic way.
 
 Religious Jews were also admonished to avoid homosexual practices because that sort of behavior would not procreate and add to the numbers of the tribe, so they were faced with a terrible dilemma -- it was unacceptable to think of a male god in erotic religious terms because of their religion's prohibitions, it was also not acceptable to think of god as a female because females just weren't supposed to be supreme or supreme beings, my goodness, they'd done everything to wipe out goddess worship and and the attendant temples of holy prostitutes for years and years, so the only acceptable thing to do was to make their deity incorporeal, having no body or sexuality. Then they were free to erotically, in a spiritual sense, embrace their deity without violating their other religious beliefs.
 
 Here endeth the lesson.
